intro: Vincetoxicum cteniophorum, commonly known as the purple false indigo, is a member of the Loganiaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Vincetoxicum cteniophorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
